meanings.definition: The quality, state, or degree of being acidic.
meanings.sent1: The acidness of the lemon made my mouth pucker.
meanings.sent2: I could taste the acidness of the vinegar in the salad dressing.
meanings.sent3: The acidness of the orange juice made me pull a funny face.
meanings.sent4: The acidness of her words stung more than any lemon.
meanings.sent5: The acidness of the tomato sauce was so strong, it felt like a punch in the mouth.

meanings.definition: The sour or sharp taste of an acid.
meanings.sent1: The acidness of the grapefruit was too much for my taste buds.
meanings.sent2: She wrinkled her nose at the strong acidness of the pickles.
meanings.sent3: The acidness of the lemonade made me pucker up like a fish.
meanings.sent4: The acidness of the lime hit my tongue like a burst of fireworks.
meanings.sent5: The acidness of the apple cider vinegar was so intense, it made my eyes water.

meanings.definition: The property of being corrosive or caustic.
meanings.sent1: The acidness of the cleaning solution burned my skin.
meanings.sent2: He could smell the strong acidness of the chemicals in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The acidness of the battery fluid made the robot short-circuit.
meanings.sent4: The acidness of the stomach acid dissolved the metal spoon.
meanings.sent5: The acidness of the vinegar was so powerful, it ate through the container.
